Package com.graph

Class Dijkstra

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.graph.Dijkstra
  • class Dijkstra
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used for Dijkstra algorithm. Receives a graph and an object of type Vehicle and uses the Dijkstra algorithm to find the shortest path from a source node to every other node.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private int[] costs
      Cost from source to each node.
      private Graph graph
      Graph used for the algorithm.
      private int nrNodes  
      private java.util.PriorityQueue<Node> pQueue
      Priority Queue used for finding next lowest cost node.
      private java.util.Map<Node,​Node> predecessor
      Map used for shortest path nodes, keeps track of predecessor nodes.
      private Vehicle vehicle
      Vehicle used for traveling.
      private java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> visited
      Contains already visited nodes, whose lowest cost is determined.

      Dijkstra​(Graph graph, Vehicle vehicle)
      Constructor with parameters for objects of type Dijkstra.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Dijkstra

        public Dijkstra​(Graph graph,
                Vehicle vehicle)
        Constructor with parameters for objects of type Dijkstra. Initializes the class variables, receiving as parameters a graph and the vehicle to be used.
        Parameters:
        graph - the graph used for the algorithm
        vehicle - the vehicle used for traveling

    • Method Detail

      • algDijkstra

        public void algDijkstra​(int source)
        The Dijkstra algorithm, receives a source node as parameter and finds the shortest path to every other node. Uses a priority queue and an adjacency list.
        Parameters:
        source - the node used as starting point for the algorithm

      • adjacentNodes

        private void adjacentNodes​(Node node)
        Updates costs for all unvisited neighbour nodes of the one given as parameter.
        Parameters:
        node - just visited node used for updating costs

      • getPath

        public java.util.List<Node> getPath​(Node target)
        Builds the shortest path used for traveling from source node to target node.
        Parameters:
        target - node used as ending point for the path
        Returns:
        shortest path between source and target

      • getMinimumCost

        public int getMinimumCost​(Node node)
        Minimum cost between source and node.
        Parameters:
        node - node used as ending point for the path
        Returns:
        the minimum cost from source to the node given as parameter
